However it is only 0.5 credits but I think it should be more than 0.5 because it was still an intensive class that required several hours outside of the classtime to complete the lab reports and study and watch the prelab lectures.

I would not recommend this course unless you're pre-med or need to take it for your major. Overall, it is just not appropriate to have this course be labeled as a half credit course when it oftentimes necessitates the same amount of energy as a full credit course. This, along with the fact that this class is graded based on the collective average rather that cutoffs that reflect our mastery, lead me to the conclusion that this course is strictly meant for STEM students that are willing to drains hours of their time to this class and not to those students that are simply interested in taking a lab course due to the competitive nature of CHEM 134L.
If you must take lab. Otherwise, it takes a lot of time from your week. I actually enjoyed being in the lab though because I loved my TF! But the lab reports were so tedious and boring.
No. It was stressful and far away and annoying.
Don't take this course if you do not have to. It is not enjoyable and definitely not worth the stress.

No because it is super time consuming and not much support is offered. The graders are looking for answers that are way too specific and dont leave room for student interpretation and insight in reflection questions, which essentially defeats the purpose of having reflection questions.
yes.
Yes, good for understanding, easy to follow along
Definitely. It's a great way to get introduced to how labs work in college.
I would, but with some caution. Its a great chemistry starter course, but the student would have to be willing to put on the needed work outside of class.
yes but it is more work than a half credit in my opinion

I did not have the best experience enjoying the course because it was one of my greatest sources of stress, and I spent so much time on each lab report that it sometimes felt like a nuisance. However, I do think my experience would have been different if my lab was later in the week, so I would recommend the course to another student with that caveat.
I would recommend this course, especially if you are taking it alongside Chem 161 because it really does help to supplement your learning, but it is a lot of work for only half a credit.

Yes, it is a great way to further your learning with chemistry. Conducting physical experiments that displayed the concepts we were learning about helped visual learners like myself and made it more fun.
Yeah, if they're already taking CHEM 161 I think it enhances learning.
If needed as a requirement, otherwise it's overly stressful over points that are not explained after being removed
It's very basic. Not super exciting. If you don't need it as a requirement, don't take it. Gives you very beginner overview of procedure and techniques. Can mostly be learned on the go.
Yes, I strongly recommend this class because it will prepare you to take on more challenging STEM courses and labs.
Yes. It is a good way to be introduced to how a chemistry lab works at Yale.
Yes, it is a great supplement to general chemistry and provides a new prospective to chemistry by being in the lab. But I would only recommend it if you need the class for your major.

If you are going premed and/or want to develop skills specific to a chemistry laboratory, I would suggest taking this class, especially with this instructor. The workload is significant, but it is very doable especially if you engage with the resources available to you, such as the teaching assistants.
Only if you need it otherwise its a grind and doesnt add that much.

Yes, I'd definitely recommend this course if Dr. Parr is teaching it, but be careful with the smaller details on lab reports and definitely talk to your lab partner/group and check over for tiny mistakes. I had heard bad things about this course but Dr. Parr is super nice and approachable and the course itself is not that difficult if you have taken AP Chemistry before.

This course provides a great lab environment, and there are lots of resources to help you succeed (TFs, office hours, etc.). I'd never been in a proper lab before this class, and I enjoyed it. However, the way that grades are determined can be frustrating since the B+/B- margin is determined based on the class average, so even if you have an A in the class, it may not stay that way once final grades are determined.

I wouldn't recommend this course to another student. If they were taking it as a requirement, I would tell them that the time in the lab can be enjoyable and interesting, but the work outside the lab is difficult to get through.
Do not take this course if you don't need it.
I would recommend this course to another student wants to learn more about Chemistry labs and become familiar with equipment.

I would definitely recommend this course to other students who want to gain basic laboratory skills. This course will give you a great foundation to build upon in future lab courses. I was able to receive great support throughout the whole semester.
Yes, however, I would be sure to warn them that there is a very high time commitment.
take it if you have to, its not that bad but its by no means an exceptional course. Plain and uninspiring.
If required, yes. I would warn them about the tedious time consuming lab reports.
Not unless its a prerequisite

I would maybe for someone in chem 161 but not chem 163. It was frustrating to write lab reports on material that you had to relearn. The workload was too much compared to the credit earned. The grading rubric looked for specific details and were often hard to get on your own.

Yes, this course is great for students looking to gain foundational research skills. The course provides a low-pressure environment and provides the tools to understand how to conduct research and labwork better.
Yes, it was as I expected, so if another student is looking to have an introductory chemistry lab course I would recommend this.

I would recommend this course to another student who is interested in developing their understanding of chemistry and how the lab setting functions. This class has a steep learning curve yet it is possible to overcome the various setbacks with learning and master the content ahead.
Not if they did not have to take it, unless they planned to take it credit/D/fail. The grading is too stressful.
Yes I enjoyed this course and what it taught me very much.
Yes
I would recommend this course to pre-med students who need it for a requirement.
No because it took way too much out of my day and the grading system is unfair so unless they absolutely have to I wouldnt recommend it
Unless this student needs it to meet a requirement, no.
Yes.
I would recommended it only if you need to take it for a prerequisite as there is not point in going through so much work if its not needed.
I had to take this course for requirements, but I would recommend it because I learned a lot of helpful lab information that I think will be useful in the future.

YesI enjoyed this course much more than I expected. I was initially worried because I'd heard lab courses can be stressful, but all the labs we do are straightforward and the TFs and Dr. Parr were always there to help.
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student because it covers the basic chemistry that will be needed for higher levels for higher chem related classes.
I would only recommend this course if it is part of your pre-requisites, unless you are really interested in chemistry.
It is a useful course as a chemistry foundation.
Yes, if you take first semester of general chemistry Id definitely also take this lab. The labs you perform build on the information you learn in class.
I would recommend only if the student needs a good foundation in chemical laboratory skills for classes later on. m
Since this course is required for the biology, chemistry, and some parts of other stem majors, all students should take this course to understand the basics of lab work dealing with chemicals.
I would recommend this course if the student wishes to learn more about the chemical processes and is interested in conducting experiments and collecting data.
No, unless you need it for a requirement. Would not take it for fun.
Only if you were pre-med/chemistry-related major.
Yes, I think its a great introduction course to take to familiarize yourself with a lab.
I would recommend this course to another student. This course helps students develop laboratory skills and experience that can useful for further laboratory activities.

I would recommend this course to students looking to get chemistry lab experience and concurrently taking a general chemistry course. Some of the labs we did genuinely helped to solidify the concepts we discussed in my lecture. 
Additionally, it was challenging enough that my ability to write lab reports with precision and attention to detail improved as well as my practical lab skills, but not so challenging that it felt impossible.
It is a good course to pair with general chemistry to build a basic understanding and see the concepts in real experiments.

I would recommend this course to another student because I was better able to understand the course material from general chemistry and the prelab/post-lab questions helped reinforce my understanding.
Yes I would recommend this class, despite sometimes harsh grading, it is a relatively fun class.
Yes, if you're pre-med or Science major you would have to take it, but otherwise no
No, I would not recommend this course unless you had to take it for your intended major.
I would recommend it only if its a requirement or prerequisite.
Not unless they're in chemistry.
I would recommend this course to another student because it prepared me for future labs at Yale and overall was a fun experience.
Yes, especially if someone is planning on going into any chemistry or biology field. I learned many important skills and could apply lecture knowledge to actual experiments.
Yes, especially if it is required for your major. Even if it isn't required, there are some really interesting experiments in this course.
No
Yes, I would. It is a very good introduction to chemistry in a lab setting and not too complex.
If its with Dr. Parr or Dr. Lantz again, then yes. A lot of the labs were cool and they never actually take all 4 hours to do.
I would strongly recommend the course if the student is taking chem lecture at the same time. The lab work closely followed what was learned in chem lecture that week.
Only if you have to for prerequisites.
Yes, only if the course in necessary for the students major or if they are premed.

If a student is required to for a major or for the premed curriculum, then I would. The workload and large time commitment for the class, which makes class scheduling somewhat arduous, means that I wouldn't recommend the class for the sake of curiosity alone.
Yes, especially if taken in conjunction with general chemistry  it helps apply concepts youve learned inside and outside the classroom.
I recommend this course if it is taught by Jonathan Parr

The workload can be quite heavy if one wishes to do well and complete every lab thoroughly, so I would only recommend this course if it is required for one's major or if one is genuinely very interested in doing chemistry lab experiments.
Yes. For many students on the premedical track this course is prerequisite for entering medical school.
Sure
No. If you are premed you have to take this so there is no option. No one takes Chem lab for fun.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. I think that this course was an excellent supplement to the general chemistry course, and enabled me to see and understand chemistry in a more palpable and accessible way, which is important if someone hasn't had much exposure to chemistry before coming to college. Many of the labs also show how chemistry is directly relevant to and ubiquitous in our everyday lives, which is also very rewarding.
Yes, this course was very enjoyable and I learned a great deal about chemistry by conducting the experiments and then considering them at greater depth when writing the lab reports.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student because it helps us dive deeper into the course material from the Chemistry lecture course we took simultaneously. I would also especially recommend this course for premed students, because it is a premed requirement.
Yes it was a great foundation and it is very interesting.
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student because it gives a good introduction into the lab and helps to develop skills of taking data and writing a lab report.

I would recommend this course to another student, because it was very helpful to me. However, the curriculum did not align with that of the Chem 163 class, so it felt sort of out of place with the Chem 163 students sometimes. It would be helpful to account for this and make this clear before students enroll in the lab.
Only if they need it for credit
Yes, in combination with Gen Chem 1.
I would recommend this course to any student who wants to gain basic chemistry lab experience or any student taking general chemistry.
If you have to take it, take it.

I don't think I would recommend this course to a student if they really wanted to experience lab work. It is definitely a supplementary course to in the information of 161 and 163. I think it does provide nice hands on experience for these courses but it is not a necessary course for understanding CHEM 161 and 163.
Yes, I would recommend because it is great for beginners at lab.

If you need this course to fulfill a major requirement you obviously have no choice of whether to take it or not, but if you're someone who is interested in gaining experience in a college lab setting and is willing to put in the work, this could be a good class for you. Definitely worth taking if you're in Gen Chem.
Mostly no, unless you love chemistry lab work or need this for some sort of prerequisite.
Yes, it helped supplement what I had learned in lecture and taught me how to identify and use lab equipment appropriately.

I would recommend this course to another student because it teaches you how to apply knowledge from chemistry classes in the laboratory and allows you to develop important laboratory safety and procedural skills.
Only for those who need to take it (ie pre-meds)
I would recommend this course for students who wish to gain experience with using chemical laboratory equipment.
If they have a passion for chemistry and stem then yes, if not-it won't be enjoyable.
No
